name: Retrieve Settings
info:
Retrieve an automation configuartaion object attachment from vault, or from Redis if alread exist, if not existing, it will be stored in Redis. 

### Node information
:Initial Release (string): With building blocks version x.x.x
:Description (string): Retrieve an automation configuartaion object attachment from vault, or from Redis if alread exist, if not existing, it will be stored in Redis. 

### Inputs
: args.settings_name (string) : *(optional)* the name of the automation configuartaion object in vault, if not provided, the name '-client_id-__settings' will be used. 
: args.attachment_name (string) : *(optional)* the name of the object attachment in vault, it has to be a .json file, defaults to 'settings.json'. 
: args.keep (boolean) : *(optional)* If **false**, delete the args object. Defaults to **false**.
: args.expire (integer): *(optional)* Number of seconds after redis deletes the topic automatically. Default is 24h.

### Outputs
1. Success
: payload (object): attachment converted to an object/array

1. Failure
: payload (object): Error message on channel 2

name: Input Form
info:
Build a generic input form.

### Inputs

: title (string): The title of the input form.
: description (string): The main description rendered above the selection table.
: type (string): The input type (e.g. checkbox, radio), if empty or false, the table is a plain output table.
: tableheader (object): An object with a list of column names (see below for details).
: dataarray (array of objects): Table data (see below for details), with checked=true a row can be preselected.
: flow (string): The flow name that will be called on form submit. The flow needs to listen for POST request on **/nodes/\<flow\>**
: hiddenfields (array of objects): Additional parameters that will be sent to the target flow (see below for details).
: httpcalls (positive Integer): if provided, a 'go back' button is added which goes back the given number of steps in window history.
: NOTE (na): strings provided for description, tableheader and dataarray will not be escaped, i.e. html code can be added (e.g. links and formatting), the creator of the automation must ensure that not unintended code-injection occurs.

### Output
: payload (html): The input page that can be returned to the browser.

### Details

The tableheader is an object containing a columns field that contains a list of header names.

    tableheader = {
            columns: [
                "column 1 header",
                "column 2 header",
                "column 3 header"
            ]
    }

Dataarray is an array of objects that contains the row data.

    dataarray = [
        {
            selection: "the value that will be posted on form submit when row 1 was selected."
            columns: [
                "value for column 1, row 1",
                "value for column 2, row 1",
                "value for column 3, row 1"
            ]
            checked: true
        },
        {
            selection: "the value that will be posted on form submit when row 2 was selected."
            columns: [
                "value for column 1, row 2",
                "value for column 2, row 2",
                "value for column 3, row 2"
            ]
        },
        {
            selection: "the value that will be posted on form submit when row 3 was selected."
            columns: [
                "value for column 1, row 3",
                "value for column 2, row 3",
                "value for column 3, row 3"
            ]
        }
    ]

hiddenfields is an array of objects that contains name / value pairs with extra parameters for the target flow.

    hiddenfields = [
        {
            name: "name of the first parameter",
            value: "value of the first parameter"
        },
        {
            name: "name of the second parameter",
            value: "value of the second parameter"
        }
    ]

name: Create Single Document Version
info:
Add a new draft version of an existing document.

### Node information
:Vault API version (string): 22.3
:Initial Release (string): With building blocks version 3.5.0
:Description (string): You can choose to either use the existing source file, or a new source file. These actions will increase the documentâ€™s minor version number.

### Inputs

: vault_api (string) :  The API endpoint for the Vault.
: session_id (string) :  A Veeva Vault session id.
: args.doc_id (string) : The ID of the document that should be versioned. 
: args.keep (boolean) :If `TRUE`, the arguments (in args) are kept after building block execution. If `FALSE` , the arguments will be deleted.

### Body Parameter

: description__v (string) : (Optional) Add a Version Description for the new draft version.

In case of same content as in previous version:

: createDraft (string) : Set to "latestContent" to create a new draft version from the existing document with the same content in the Vault. This does not require uploading a file. 

In case of new content:

: createDraft (string) : Set to "uploadedContent" to create a new draft version by putting the content into the file parameter.
: file (string) : Use this parameter to include the new document content. Use the following structure.
        "file": {
            "value": <content to be in the new file>,
            "options": {
                "filename": <source file name to appear in the file details>
            }
        }

### Outputs


1. Success
: payload (object): The response shows the new version numbers.
       {
            responseStatus: "SUCCESS"
            "responseMessage": "New draft successfully created.",
            "major_version_number__v": <new major version number>,
            "minor_version_number__v": <new minor version number>
       }



2. Failure
: payload (object): An object containing the error messages.
        {
            responseStatus: "FAILURE"
            errors: <array>
                 0: <object>
                    type: <type of overall error>
                    message: <overall error message>
        }

name: Redis queue (2)
info:
Save a node-red object to the redis database and restore later. 

### Node information
:Initial Release (string): With building blocks version x.x.x
:Description (string): Save a node-red object to the redis database and restore later.

### Inputs
: args.method (string) : *(required)* **SET** to write to redis as a single object, **GET** to read a single object from redis, **RPUSH** to append or create a list of objects in redis, **LRANGE** to retrieve list item objects from redis, use args.topic for the topics and provide the range as array with 0 based start and end (i.e. use [0, -1] for all, negative values count from end), **DELETE** to delete the topic from redis. 
: args.topic (string)  : *(required)* A unique identifier, must be the same for the write and read step for a queued object.
: args.keep_queue (boolean) : *(optional)* Only when reading. If **true**, keep the queued message for later. If **false**, delete the queue from redis. Defaults to **true**.
: args.keep (boolean) : *(optional)* If **false**, delete the args object. Defaults to **false**.
: args.expire (integer): *(optional)* Number of seconds after redis deletes the topic automatically. Default is to never expire.
: payload (object)     : Only when writing. A node red data object.

### Outputs
1. Read Success
: payload (object): The object retrieved from redis on channel 1

1. Write Success
: payload (string): 'OK' on channel 1

1. Failure
: payload (object): Error message on channel 2

meta.desc: saves and retrieves the payload to redis using args.topic as dientifier

name: Login (2)
info:
Login to Veeva Vault and create a session id

This node checks if there is a Veeva Vault session id in the cookies and returns it.
Otherwise, there are three authentication stragies to create a new session id:

1. **Retrieve the current session id from the Veeva Vault UI**

   This only works, if the flow runs embedded in the Veeva Vault UI and the "post session"
   feature was enabled for the web action. The strategy supports delegated sessions as well.

1. **Login via Single-Sign-On**

   This only works for SSO enabled accounts. The node redirects to the Azure AD authorization
   endpoint, which will authenticate the user and come back to this node with an identity
   token. The identity token is then used to create a Veeva Vault session id, the session id
   is stored in the cookies and the original flow will be restartet.

1. **Login via username and password**

   This only works for basic accounts with a password (i.e. non-SSO).

### Inputs

: payload.vault_domain (string): The domain for the target vault.
: *payload.sso* (any): (Optional) Use the SSO authentication strategy. The value of this parameter is ignored and can even be empty. If this parameter is missing and there is no username and password, the session will be retrieved from the Veeva Vault UI.
: *payload.username* (string): (Optional) The username for a basic account. If both, username and password are provides, login via username and password will be performed.
: *payload.password* (string): (Optional) The password for a basic account. If both, username and password are provides, login via username and password will be performed.
: *client_id* (string): (Optional) An identifier for the Veeva Vault API for diagnosis. If unset, the building block will set the client id to "BRAVE Automation". 

### Outputs

: session_id (string): An active session id for the target vault. The session id will also be stored in a cookie, so that it will be re-used for the lifetime of the session.
: vault_api (string): The REST API endpoint for the target vault in the format **https://<vault_domain>/api/**. Note, that the value does not include a version for the Vault API.
: client_id (string): The specified client id or "BRAVE Automation" if unspecified.
: credentials (object): Multi-session support. The key is **vault_domain** and it contains an object with **vault_api** and **session_id** as described above for each authenticated Vault.

### Details

The following cookies will be set and can be used by flows. Only the last authenticated Vault
via SSO or Vault UI will be stored. Authentications via username and password will not be
recorded in cookies.

: vault_domain  (string): The vault domain as specified in the initial call.
: session_id (string): The current active session id.
: user_id (number): The id of the current user.
: vault_id (number): The id of the target vault.

CTA Application:
     Planning phase â€“ Create Event and CTA Content Plan (The first step to create tracking objects for a CTA is the creation of Event(s). When IMPD information is available or At time of document collection, the Event and Content Plan can be created)

     Preparation phase â€“ Create Country Application(s) (Applications would only be created if not yet available. Therefore, it is strongly recommended to first conduct a search for already existing applications. The corresponding CTA Amendment Event is needed to perform this action.)

     Preparation phase â€“ Create Related Records (When the final core package is ready for dispatch, Regulatory Objective and Submission records must be created to track the submission process. The corresponding CTA Amendment Event and Application(s) of the involved countries are needed to perform this action.)

     Preparation phase â€“ Create Country Application(s) (Usually the applications are only needed when first CTA application and only need to be created if not ye available. Therefore, it is strongly recommended to first conduct a search for already existing applications. The corresponding CTA Application Event is needed to perform this action.)

name: Apply Jsonata
info:
Transform a node-red object using a jsonata expression provided as a string at runtime. 

### Node information
:Initial Release (string): With building blocks version x.x.x
:Description (string): Transform a node-red object using a jsonata expression provided as a string.

### Inputs
: args.jsonata (string) : *(required)* The jsonata expression to be used, has to be a valid string appropriately escaped. If empty, output will be SUCCESS and payload undefined
: payload (object)     : *(optional)* A node red data object to be transformed by args.jsonata. If empty, output will be SUCCESS and empty

### Outputs
1. Success
: payload (object): The transformed object

1. Failure
: payload (object): Error message on channel 2

name: write to loop result and prepare query

name: Apply Jsonata
info:
Transform a node-red object using a jsonata expression provided as a string at runtime. 

### Node information
:Initial Release (string): With building blocks version x.x.x
:Description (string): Transform a node-red object using a jsonata expression provided as a string.

### Inputs
: args.jsonata (string) : *(required)* The jsonata expression to be used, has to be a valid string appropriately escaped. If empty, output will be SUCCESS and payload undefined
: payload (object)     : *(optional)* A node red data object to be transformed by args.jsonata. If empty, output will be SUCCESS and empty

### Outputs
1. Success
: payload (object): The transformed object

1. Failure
: payload (object): Error message on channel 2

$xlsortv:=$$.flow.xlink.doc_vers[id=$dp.xlink_id	                                    and	                                    source_document_id__v = $ps.id 	                                    and
